data.title: Comm 282 Week 9

data.text:
Comm Week 9

Sam Kinison First Appearance on Litterman

● Engages audience

David Sedaris

Cleese

● T rouble r elationship between humor and religion (class dedicated to th is difficult

religion)

○ Use humor and satire to criticize and make fun of Islam

● We have to get back to a place where people can talk about the democracy we li ve in

and everyone is allowed to have their opinions and it is okay to be of fended

Whos on First Routine

Problems of Language

Religion and Humour

● Religion is close to people’ s motivations — people start to question it… makes your

question your living

● The way people govern a lot of societies (foundational)

● So easy to make fun of but people take it very seriously

● Comedy = inherently critical

● Y ou have to consider the concept of faith (trust)

○ Humour takes things apart and examines the truth while making fun of it

○ Religion is the faith and trusting part

The Penny and the Cent

● Apply it the religious humor debate

● Reacting to the cent and believing its true because you have a penny and equate it to

the same thing

Blasphemy

● Not supposed to ask questions about the truth you have been raised to believe

● Defintion: noun; the act or offense of sp eaking sacrilegiously about God or sacred

things_____

● Sacrilege def

● Sacred def

● V erence def

● God def

● We are born and sin and it’ s a problem, we have to do something about it

Pleasure

● Is there a resolvable dif ference between the right to offend and the moral respon sibility

not to?

● It’s no t about religion, it’s about the human heart and how we ask people to engage in

concepts

● What does censorship do?

● What does free speech do?

○ Creates a lot of upset and always will

● Does morality come from teh church? Did religion give us our sense of right and wrong?

○ No
